speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: Miss Holland, I’m Nurse Waite. I’ll be assisting in your procedure.

speaker: HOLLAND
line: Is it going to hurt?

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: You won’t feel a thing. There isn’t even any blood. Dr. Lloyd’s done over a thousand lipo procedures. You’re in good hands.

speaker: ORDERLY
line: OK, here we go.

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: I’m going to give a tranquilizer now, and then right before the operation the doctor will give you injections of saline and anesthetic. And all you have to worry about is buying a new wardrobe.

speaker: DUTY NURSE
line: Here are your messages doctor.

speaker: BACKGROUND DOCTOR
line: Oh, fine thanks.

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: Your liposuction patient is prepped and waiting in room five.

speaker: DR. LLOYD
line: Fine, what else am I scheduled for?

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: You’ve got a scalp reduction, and a blepharoplasty following.

speaker: DR. LLOYD
line: Are they prepped?

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: Um, no. Would you like me...

speaker: DR. LLOYD
line: Get them ready please. I’d like to move right along this morning.

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: Yes, doctor.

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: How are you doing?

speaker: HOLLAND
line: Is the doctor going to be much longer? I think my tranquilizer’s starting to wear off.

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: I’m sorry, um, I -- I don’t know where...

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: Doctor Lloyd!!

speaker: DOCTOR LLOYD
line: I think this patient is finished.

speaker: DOCTOR LLOYD
line: What else do you call it? When you’re in your body and out if it at the same time? Without the ability to control your actions – to stop yourself from doing what I did to that poor young man? What else do you call it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Spirit possession or demon possession. While these kinds of extraordinary mental states have been well documented throughout history, they’ve been much maligned, rightly or wrongly, and haven’t held up in court well as a criminal defense.

speaker: LAWYER
line: I would like to reiterate that I have advised my client against speaking to you, and I would appreciate it if you would direct any legal discussion to counsel.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Doctor Lloyd, are you currently taking any kind of medication?

speaker: DOCTOR LLOYD
line: The occasional sleeping pill, and uh, uh, prescription antacid for my stomach.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Would you mind allowing me to check the dosage, and which ones?

speaker: DOCTOR LLOYD
line: No, I really... I would like to know why, because I...

speaker: LAWYER
line: I think you’ve gotten a clear picture of my client’s story and his willingness to go along with your investigation.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, I believe we have.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Doctor Lloyd, you say that you’ve taken sleeping pills. How much sleep did you get the night before?

speaker: DOCTOR LLOYD
line: : I, uh...I can’t recall.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The sleeping pill he was taking was something called Somanil.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’ve heard of it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s popular because it works directly on the central nervous system and it isn’t stored in body tissue past its intended use. But it’s also very controversial for its addictivness and its effect on long term behavior.

speaker: MULDER
line: What – What was the date of ah, Dr. Lloyd’s prescription?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, he started taking the drug five years ago, and he went through – ooh, he took a lot of it. 19 one hundred tablet refills.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wow.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know, that’s more than a pill a day.

speaker: MULDER
line: An addiction in other words.

speaker: SCULLY
line: An addiction which very well could have altered his ability to do his job.

speaker: MULDER
line: How many of these procedures would you say Dr. Lloyd’s performed?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Judging from his schedule the day of the accident, hundreds, and probably thousands.

speaker: MULDER
line: And not one fatality.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You’re missing my point here, Mulder. This – this place is a veritable factory. Cosmetic surgery is the boom industry of the medical world. And ASU wards like this are a gold mine.

speaker: MULDER
line: Everybody’s doing it, so I hear.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And a brand new, state of the art facility like this can support an entire hospital.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you suppose these are?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: These five marks on your brand new state of the art floor?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, they look like they were made by, uh, the coasters from an OR table or some kind of equipment.

speaker: MULDER
line: They look to me like they were burned or scorched.

speaker: MULDER
line: In the shape of a pentagram.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, if you want to connect the dots here, you should look at the facts. Latrogenic deaths or – or deaths due to doctor error are upwards of 80,000 a year. Dr. Lloyd was pushing his limits. He was an accident waiting to happen.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m not a doctor , Scully, but you’ve got to be pushing pretty hard to mistake a beer belly for a bald head – not to mention door number three.

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s amazing that no one saw him in time to stop him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe they were all possessed.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t think it’s just a simple possession, Scully. I think it’s more like sorcery or black magic or something like that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Excuse me, what kind of procedure is that up there?

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: It’s a rhinoplasty. I’m sorry, who are you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, we’re with the FBI. I’m Agent Scully, and this is Agent Mulder. We’re investigating a patient’s death here.

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: Oh, uh...yes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You’re Rebecca Waite. You were the attending nurse at the time. Am I correct?

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: Yes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Could you explain to me what happened to Dr. Lloyd. How - how a mistake like this could happen?

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: No - no I-I can’t really, um, I wasn’t in the OR at the time and... it’s, uh, difficult for me in my position.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you observe Dr. Lloyd at all before the accident?

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: I helped prep the patient. I was supposed to assist. I did my job as a nurse.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you aware that Dr. Lloyd is claiming he was possessed during the incident?

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: I guess it’s cheaper than malpractice insurance.

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh huh.

speaker: DR.SHANNON
line: Give him 500 c.c.s of ringers wide open before he goes to recovery. I need you to keep up with me here.

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: Right away, Dr. Shannon.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, Dr. Shannon, can we have a word with you, please?

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: I’m sorry. I’ve got a patient who can’t wait.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, there’s magic going on here, Mulder, only it’s being done with silicone, collagen, and a well placed scalpel.

speaker: DR. KAPLAN
line: What we have to do here is keep calm and do nothing out of the ordinary. The appearance here of any dissembling or impropriety will only deepen the FBI’s probe on top of Dr. Lloyd’s insurance investigation.

speaker: DR. ILAQUA
line: Dr. Lloyd has made us a target.

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: The last thing we need is to be caught up in an expose.

speaker: DR. KAPLAN
line: Then they start looking at our books again. I mean it’s bad enough we have to explain why buttock lipostructures cost 4,000 a pop.

speaker: DR. ILAQUA
line: We look greedy, therefore we look guilty.

speaker: DR. FRANKLYN
line: We haven’t done anything wrong, Dr. Ilaqua.

speaker: DR. KAPLAN
line: If we give any credence or credibility to Dr. Lloyd’s story, they’re going to burn us at the stake.

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: What about the other personnel. They were talking to the nurse .. Waite?

speaker: DR. FRANKLYN
line: She can’t tell them anything.... because she doesn’t know anything.

speaker: FEMALE PATIENT
line: I can’t feel my feet. I’m having a skin peel, but I can’t feel my feet.

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: It’s okay, it’s okay. Your feet are still there. They aren’t going anywhere.

speaker: FEMALE PATIENT
line: I... it’s just .. I’m afraid to be put to sleep. What if I don’t wake up?

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: Not to worry, not to worry. I want you to relax and think about your beautiful new face.

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: You’re in good hands. We’re going to protect you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You wanted to show me something?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. A videotape. This videotape of the operation shows that the five marks delineating the pentagram were in evidence prior to the patient’s death.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Stop it a second. My god, Mulder. He basically stabbed the man to death in his sleep.

speaker: MULDER
line: Which only underscores the strangeness. A sane man acting under his own volition could never perform such an act. Look. There.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, presuming that has anything to do with this, who would have put them there?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t know. A pentagram is supposed to be a symbol of protection and positive power used to control the elemental forces.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, then it doesn’t even make sense.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but it does make sense that - that witchcraft or black magic would find a theatre in a place like this, preying on the weak and vainglorious.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But there’s no other evidence of anything like witchcraft taking place here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe there is. What was that, uh, prescription that Dr. Lloyd was taking?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The sleeping pills?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, the stomach antacid. Read me what it’s made from.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "An anti-spasmodic whose active ingredients include belladonna alkaloids –"

speaker: MULDER
line: Belladonna. It’s also known as Witch’s Berry – that’s an herb used in hexing rituals.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, do you know how many pharmaceuticals listed in the PDR contain belladonna?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, just one – the one Dr. Lloyd was taking.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, if it’s that simple, why don’t you put out an APB for someone riding a broom and wearing a tall black hat?

speaker: MULDER
line: You jest, Scully, but there’s a good chance that this hex or ritual or whatever it is, may not be finished.

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: Well, the FBI seemed to have backed off at least for the time being.

speaker: DR. ILAQUA
line: Yes.

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: Are you finished for the day?

speaker: DR. ILAQUA
line: Yes.

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: I’ve got a laser peel. Then I’m out of here. We’re going to get through this, Eric. All we have to do is keep our heads on straight.

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: The patient is prepped, Dr. Shannon. Is there anything you need me to do?

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: Yes, I’m going to need a clean pair of scrubs from the laundry. I forgot to pick some up.

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: I’ll get them now. Is there anything you need, Dr. Ilaqua?

speaker: DR. ILAQUA
line: No, thank you.

speaker: DR.SHANNON
line: Am I prepped in another room?

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: No, your patient’s in OR 2. Who’s that?

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: That’s Dr. Ilaqua. What the hell is he doing with my patient?

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: Dr. Ilaqua! Open this door! Eric! Open this door immediately! Dr. Ilaqua, do you hear me? You’ve got to stop this now!

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: This is wrong! What are you doing? Stop this right now! Eric open this door immediately! This is Dr. Shannon! I said stop this now! STOP!!!!!

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don’t remember anything, Dr. Ilaqua? How you got in the room, or what compelled you to do such a thing?

speaker: DR. ILAQUA
line: No, I was on my way home.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you realize what you’ve done now?

speaker: DR. ILAQUA
line: Yes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: May I? I’ll be right back.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you examine the victim?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, just Dr. Ilaqua, why?

speaker: MULDER
line: I found something else on the videotape. Right there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are they? Bruises?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t know, but the orientation of the points describes a pentagram again. See.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I found something, too.

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s the same prescription Dr. Lloyd was taking.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think it’s just a coincidence?

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: Any change in scheduling or workload is going to give the appearance of covering guilt. We can’t compromise our position on this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sorry to barge in, but this is a matter of some urgency.

speaker: DR. FRANKLYN
line: Uh, no, please. Dr. Jack Franklyn. May we ask that you sit down?

speaker: MULDER
line: It appears we’ve interrupted a *gathering.*

speaker: DR. FRANKLYN
line: Gathering? Sir .. can you imagine this group’s concern about what’s happened, and our urgency to resolve this? And to finally bring the person responsible to justice.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Finally.

speaker: DR. FRANKLYN
line: I don’t know how much of this you know, but uh, ten years ago there were several deaths at this hospital here in the ASU and like uh, the recent deaths they were all ruled accidental.

speaker: MULDER
line: Were any of you here at the time?

speaker: DR. FRANKLYN
line: A few of us, yes, but .. more importantly... there’s a nurse, Rebecca Waite. She was on the ward during those incidents. Six weeks ago, she transferred back here to the ASU.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you have any other reasons to suspect her?

speaker: DR. FRANKLYN
line: Well, she’s the only person on the ward who had some contact with each of the victims and the doctors involved.

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you spoken with her?

speaker: DR. FRANKLYN
line: No, she left the uh, hospital early, and no one’s been able to find her.

speaker: MULDER
line: Probable cause.

speaker: SCULLY
line: On the suspicion of being a witch?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What could she have been doing in here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Probably not tax returns.

speaker: 911 RECORDING
line: You have reached the 911 emergency line. Please stay on the line...

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: You don’t know what you’re doing! Let me go, now! They don’t understand. You have to tell them!

speaker: MULDER
line: I want to speak to her.;

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: Tell them!

speaker: MULDER
line: I need to speak to her...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, don’t...

speaker: NURSE WAITE
line: I tried to stop him, but it’s too powerful. Someone has to stop....

speaker: SCULLY
line: Get the paramedics over here! Get the paramedic over here now!

speaker: EMT
line: Watch it. Come on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She’s swallowed straight pins and is bleeding internally. You’ve got to get her into surgery immediately.

speaker: EMT
line: There we go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m going with her to the ER.

speaker: DR. FRANKLYN
line: I would have done it myself, but I’m still a little shaky.

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: Jack, you’re a lot cooler than I’d be if it’d been me.

speaker: DR. FRANKLYN
line: Ah, well, the important thing is it’s over now.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr, Franklyn?

speaker: DR.FRANKLYN
line: Ah, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: I came by to see if you were okay.

speaker: DR. FRANKLYN
line: Yes. I - I’m fine. Thank you.

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: That woman broke in here. She was in here waiting for him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Looks like she took a pretty good shot at you.

speaker: DR. FRANKLYN
line: Yes, apparently.

speaker: MULDER
line: Nothing that a little plastic surgery won’t fix up though, huh? Do you have any uh, idea why she might have attacked you?

speaker: DR. FRANKLYN
line: Well, I’m the one who voiced suspicion about her.

speaker: MULDER
line: She wouldn’t have known that.

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: Could have been any one of us – she’s obviously quite mad.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ah, we have reason to believe that she’s a practitioner of ritual magic.

speaker: DR. FRANKLYN
line: Ritual magic?

speaker: MULDER
line: A practicing witch.

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: You’re saying she’s who’s responsible for Dr. Lloyd and Dr. Ilaqua? That witchcraft caused them to kill those patients?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think a lot remains to be proven.

speaker: DR. FRANKLYN
line: Hem, I’m sorry. Ah, This evening has been a bit much, and I really need to get some rest.

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: I think all of us would like to get some rest... get back to work and put this behind us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it’s me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Come in, it’s open.

speaker: MULDER
line: God, you look tired.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I do? I was just at the hospital. Our suspect, Rebecca Waite was just pronounced 20 minutes ago.

speaker: MULDER
line: Cause of death?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Massive blood loss due to esophageal hemorrhaging caused by the expulsion of hundreds of straight pins.

speaker: MULDER
line: You ever seen anything like that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well... in med school I saw some weird stuff. Uh, there’s a - a psychiatric disorder called pica which is characterized by the craving for non-food objects like clay, rocks, glue, but if she swallowed...

speaker: MULDER
line: She would have died long before she yacked them up on the driveway. Unless, of course she didn’t ingest them at all, which would fit with the phenomenon called allotriophagy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Allotriophagy?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, the spontaneous vomiting or disgorgement of foul or strange objects usually associated with someone possessed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I - I won’t refute that this woman may have been practicing the occult, but... what comes out must first go in.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, according to this book people throughout history have coughed up all kinds of things from cue balls to butcher’s knives without any explanation of how they got there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where’d you get this from?

speaker: MULDER
line: Rebecca Waite’s house. It’s the same place I got this. This calendar was open to April. The 30th was marked by a symbol that you’re familiar with by now?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What’s the significance of the 30th?

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s one of the four Greater Witches' Sabbaths, there seasonal high holy days – according to that book over there, it’s also known as "Roodmas." It’s also the birth date of the first victim. Now July 31st, is also marked with a pentagram. This coincides with "Lammas", another one of the Witches' Sabbaths. It’s also the birth date of the second victim.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you think she was choosing her victims based on their birthdays.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, no, remember, I said the pentagram is a - is a protective symbol. I think Rebecca Waite was trying to save those patients. I think she knew that they were in danger.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Which made her attack Dr. Franklyn.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think she knew something about him and I think we should find out what that is before he goes back to work.

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: I just got a very disturbing call.

speaker: DR. KAPLAN
line: From whom?

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: The FBI. They were asking about patients’ birth dates. They’re on their way over here right now.

speaker: DR. KAPLAN
line: I thought this was over.

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: Apparently not.

speaker: DR. KAPLAN
line: You had a good thing going, you can bet somebody will try and take it away. I’m beginning to understand why a man becomes a conservative - he’s got something to conserve. Are you all right, Jack?

speaker: DR. FRANKLYN
line: Yeah, I just didn’t get much sleep last night.

speaker: DR. KAPLAN
line: No, of course you didn’t.

speaker: DR. FRANKLYN
line: I’ll be fine.

speaker: DR. KAPLAN
line: Gail, push my ostoplasty back half an hour.

speaker: GAIL
line: Yes, doctor.

speaker: DR. KAPLAN
line: I’m taking your chem peel. You’re going home.

speaker: DR. FRANKLYN
line: I said I’ll be fine.

speaker: DR. KAPLAN
line: Take a look at yourself. You look like hell, Jack.

speaker: DR. FRANKLYN
line: Look, I appreciate the offer...

speaker: DR. KAPLAN
line: Don’t get me wrong. I am not being magnanimous, here. We just can’t afford to make any more mistakes right now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. Thank you. Dr. Franklyn’s already left, but his office confirms that one of his patients has a birth date which corresponds with one of the Sabbaths.

speaker: MULDER
line: When is that patient scheduled?

speaker: SCULLY
line: This morning – she’s already in pre-op, and one of the other doctors is filling in.

speaker: PATIENT
line: Is Doctor Franklyn okay?

speaker: DR. KAPLAN
line: He’s just not feeling very well.

speaker: PATIENT
line: Oh. I-I suppose this is one of those procedures that all doctors here could deal with, is-isn’t it?

speaker: DR. KAPLAN
line: Yes.

speaker: PATIENT
line: Yes. Dr. Franklyn said that a c-chemical skin peel is safe... almost... risk... free.

speaker: MULDER
line: We’re looking for Dr. Shannon.

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: Oh!

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: Our practice has been affiliated with Greenwood for thirteen years. Now the ASU accounts for over 50% of this hospital’s revenue. Do you understand what that means?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It means that while doctors in other fields have seen their earnings fall because of managed health care, you’ve all managed to become wealthy.

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: We fill a need. We didn’t create it. Everyone wants to be beautiful. But our success made us arrogant. I’m willing to accept responsibility for certain of our... mistakes.

speaker: MULDER
line: "Mistakes?" Like those patient deaths ten years ago?

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: That any of us could be capable of such gross negligence was inconceivable.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you covered it up.

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: If we did it was with the hospital’s blessing. They conducted an internal investigation. We have become too valuable an asset, something to protect. Even at the cost of five people’s lives.

speaker: MULDER
line: There were five deaths?

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: Yes. Four patients. The fifth was a colleague of ours who... for all intents and purposes, worked himself to death. He died of a drug overdose.

speaker: MULDER
line: What was his name?

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: Dr. Cox. Clifford Cox.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you have a file on him?

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: Probably in the computer.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right, I’m going to need that and the files on those patient deaths ten years ago.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why, Mulder? What are you thinking?

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr. Clifford Cox, birth date July 7th 1939, now can you take that photo and run it through the cosmetic surgery program I saw on this computer?

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: It’ll take me a few seconds to load up the software.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I’m still not sure where you’re going with this.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ten years ago, four patients died. Like the recent victims, their birth dates all match the Witches' Sabbaths. Except Dr. Cox.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But Cox was a doctor. Nothing about his death matches up except its coincidence.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe, maybe not.

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: I’m on line here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, now this software was created to give patients an idea of their projected result, right?

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: Within the limits of what the patient comes in with, we try to approach that aesthetic ideal. The computer runs a program based upon a matrix of relative proportions.

speaker: MULDER
line: Vanity. Vanity,... all is vanity.

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: Here it is.

speaker: MULDER
line: Now, can you move the eyes further apart and strengthen the forehead?

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: That is beyond our surgical capabilities.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know.

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: I don’t understand. It looks like Jack Franklyn.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where else do you think he would be?

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: I don’t know. I’ll check the OR. Maybe he’s there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He’s not answering his pages.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you try his home?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Answering machine. What are you thinking, Mulder? That Dr. Cox murdered these patients ten years ago then became Dr. Franklyn?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, Scully. I think he murdered those patients so he could become Dr. Franklyn.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This kind of transformation is medically impossible.

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s not medicine, Scully. It’s blood sacrifice.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Blood sacrifice?

speaker: MULDER
line: The most potent offering in black magic. What if this man, having reached the limits of medical miracles, decided to stage a miracle all his own?

speaker: SCULLY
line: So this man committed these murders in order to make himself beautiful?

speaker: MULDER
line: Everybody wants to be beautiful, Scully.

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: Jack. What are you doing?

speaker: DR. FRANKLYN
line: I’m so glad that you’re here.

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: Jack, stay right where you are.

speaker: DR. FRANKLYN
line: I hope those instruments were properly sterilized.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr. Franklyn?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, come over here. Stop right there. Look what you’re standing on. This one’s different. It’s been inverted. See these two upright points here? They represent the God of Lust, attacking heaven with its horns.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, he’s inscribed all the names of the patients who were killed.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Clear the way. Moving through! What did you swallow?

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: nan

speaker: DOCTOR
line: What did you swallow?

speaker: ORDERLY
line: She didn’t say.

speaker: DOTOR
line: I’m going in to do an exploratory laparotomy.

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: Please... don’t.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Give her two units blood, stat. Someone get a 16 gauge IV in and open it wide.

speaker: NURSE
line: I’ll get the IV, Doctor.

speaker: DR. SHANNON
line: No... please no,.... no....no, please, don’t...

speaker: MULDER
line: Where’s Dr. Shannon? They said she was brought in here in an emergency?

speaker: NURSE
line: Dr. Shannon?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, in here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Don’t let them operate on her. Hold them off until you hear from me!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are you going?

speaker: MULDER
line: To find Dr. Franklyn.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Forceps.

speaker: NURSE
line: Here you go.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Sponge it. Suction.

speaker: NURSE
line: Suction.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Saline.

speaker: NURSE
line: Saline.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: More sponge.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You have to stop this procedure immediately.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Whoever that person is, get her out of here, now!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m Special Agent Dana Scully. I’m an FBI agent.

speaker: NURSE
line: Get out here, now!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Listen to me! I’m a doctor.

speaker: DOCTOR 2
line: What the hell’s going on here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m a federal agent.

speaker: DOCTOR 2
line: I don’t care who you are. You can’t interrupt a surgery in progress. This woman could die.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That’s exactly what I’m trying to prevent.

speaker: INTERCOM
line: Dr. Hallender, please call obstretics. Dr. Hallender, please call obstetrics.

speaker: MULDER
line: What happened?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, they saved her life. They just pulled a whole whack of surgical instruments out of-of her intestinal tract. God only knows how they got there.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then it failed.

speaker: HYSTERICAL NURSE
line: I tried to stop him! He just went crazy!

speaker: DOCTOR
line: We’re losing her, fast!

speaker: MULDER
line: What is this patient’s birth date?

speaker: SCULLY
line: October 31. Halloween.

speaker: MULDER
line: On Samhain... the Fourth Witches’ Sabbath.

speaker: FEMALE DOCTOR
line: I can’t tell you how happy I am that you’ve decided to join us, Doctor Hartman.

speaker: DR. HARTMAN
line: Well, I like what I’ve seen so far. The truth is, I’ve always been drawn to Los Angeles.

speaker: FEMALE DOCTOR
line: With your credentials, I’m sure you had plenty of options. I’ve been reviewing your patient portfolio. Your work is among the most impressive I’ve ever seen.

speaker: DR. HARTMAN
line: I like to say whoever God didn’t get around to creating in his own image, it’s our job to recreate in ours.
